title: Take Me, O My Father, Take Me

verses.html:
1
Take me, O my Father, take me!
Take me, save me, thro’ Thy Son;
That which Thee wouldst have me, make me,
Let Thy will in me be done.

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
Long from Thee my footsteps straying,
Thorny proved the way I trod;
Weary come I now, and praying,
Take me to Thy love, my God!

2
Fruitless years with grief recalling,
Humbly I confess my sin;
At Thy feet, O Father, falling,
To Thy household take me in.

verses.label: 2C
verses.html:
2
Freely now to Thee I proffer
This relenting heart of mine;
Freely life and soul I offer,
Gift unworthy love like Thine.

3
Once the world’s Redeemer, dying,
Bore our sins upon the tree;
On that sacrifice relying,
Now I look in hope to Thee:

verses.label: 3C
verses.html:
3
Father, take me! all forgiving,
Fold me to Thy loving breast;
In Thy love forever living,
I must be forever blest!
